Sure! Here are a few tips for finding a good music therapist:

1. Look for a board-certified music therapist: The Certification Board for Music Therapists (CBMT) is the national organization that oversees the certification of music therapists. Board-certified music therapists have completed a rigorous training program and have passed an exam to demonstrate their knowledge and skills. You can find a directory of board-certified music therapists on the CBMT website.

2. Get referrals: Ask your healthcare provider or mental health professional for a referral to a music therapist. You can also ask friends or family members for recommendations.

3. Check credentials and experience: Look for a music therapist who has experience working with individuals with anxiety or other mental health conditions. It's also important to check that their credentials are up-to-date and that they hold the appropriate state licenses and certifications.

4. Consider location and availability: Look for a music therapist who is located close to your home or workplace and whose schedule works with yours. 

5. Schedule a consultation: Many music therapists offer a free consultation to discuss your needs and see if music therapy is the right fit for you. This is a great opportunity to ask questions, get to know the therapist, and see if you feel comfortable working with them.

Remember, finding the right music therapist takes time and effort, but it can be worth the investment in your mental health and wellbeing.
